text.name: console_notes
text.text: The Family Computer Disk Systemis a peripheral for Nintendo's Family Computer home video game console, released only in Japan on February 21, 1986. It uses proprietary floppy disks called "Disk Cards" for cheaper data storage and it adds a new high-fidelity sound channel for supporting FDS games.

text.name: memory
text.text: Memory: 32 kB disk cache plus 8 kB game RAM

text.name: sound
text.text: Sound: PSG 5 channel mono + 1 channel of wavetable synth
